Fix: Pre-select clicked date in Add Date modal

Fixed bug where clicking a date without data would always show today''s date in the "Add New Date" modal instead of the clicked date.

Problem:
- When clicking a calendar date without data, the modal would open
- The date field would always default to today''s date
- User had to manually change the date to the one they clicked

Root Cause:
- MainView.tsx didn''t pass the clicked date to AddDateModal
- AddDateModal always initialized with getTodayStorageFormat()
- No mechanism to update the date when modal opened

Solution:

AddDateModal.tsx:
- Added optional initialDate prop to pre-select a specific date
- Added useEffect to update selectedDate when modal opens with initialDate
- Gracefully falls back to today''s date when no initialDate provided

MainView.tsx:
- Added selectedDateForModal state to track clicked date
- Updated handleDateClick to set selectedDateForModal before opening modal
- Passed initialDate prop to AddDateModal component
- Reset selectedDateForModal when modal closes or FAB button clicked

Behavior:
- Click calendar date without data â†’ modal opens with that date pre-selected
- Click floating "Add" button â†’ modal opens with today''s date (default)
- Close modal â†’ resets selected date for next use

Benefits:
- Better UX: users don''t need to manually select the date they just clicked
- Intuitive behavior: modal shows the date the user was interested in
- Maintains flexibility: FAB button still defaults to today
